backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no logic implemented.
feature_evidence.json: Lists implemented dashboard features, associated files, components, and test IDs for backlog roll‑number clickability and callback integration.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Contains prewritten one‑sentence summaries of major frontend files including upload, dashboard, comparison, parsing, analytics, and chart components.
frontend/index.css: Defines Tailwind layers and extensive OKLCH CSS variables for light and dark themes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point loading SheetJS and bootstrapping the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main application component managing upload, dashboard, and comparison views plus department and semester filtering with analytics computation.
frontend/src/components/charts/SimpleBar: SVG bar chart with dynamic width, scroll support, and value/label rendering.
frontend/src/components/charts/SimpleLin: Responsive SVG line chart with gridlines, point markers, and percentage labels.
frontend/src/components/charts/SimplePie: SVG pie chart computing slices from totals and displaying legend with percentages.
frontend/src/features/comparison/Semeste: Renders semester-to-semester analytics comparison with trend charts and a detailed metrics table.
frontend/src/features/dashboard/BacklogD: Displays backlog groups with collapsible sections showing affected students and supports roll-number selection.
frontend/src/features/dashboard/Semester: Main semester dashboard combining charts, subject analysis, backlog panels, and student lookup with filtering.
frontend/src/features/dashboard/StudentD: Shows a student's detailed academic record with subject results and overall status, or an error if missing.
frontend/src/features/dashboard/StudentR: Search interface for finding students by roll number within filtered or all departments.
frontend/src/features/dashboard/SubjectA: Lists subjects sorted by backlog count and allows viewing failed students per subject.
frontend/src/features/upload/UploadScree: React UI for uploading Excel files, handling drag-drop, file selection, and parsing, then forwarding parsed data.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor instance based on Internet Identity, refetching dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, loading stored identities and exposing login and logout helpers.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file reserved for future React Query hooks for backend integration.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles with custom CSS variables for light/dark themes and global styling.
frontend/src/lib/analytics/backlogDistri: Computes backlog distribution by grouping students based on the number of backlogged subjects.
frontend/src/lib/analytics/computeSemest: Generates semester-level analytics such as pass rates, backlog counts, and subject-wise backlog frequencies.
frontend/src/lib/analytics/subjectFailur: Builds per-subject lists of students who failed, returning sorted roll number arrays.
frontend/src/lib/excel/parseExcelFile.ts: Parses Excel files using XLSX, detects long vs wide formats, and converts rows into structured ParsedData.
frontend/src/lib/format/numberFormat.ts: Utility functions for formatting numbers, percentages, and decimals safely.
frontend/src/lib/guards/assertions.ts: Assertion helpers ensuring values are defined, arrays non-empty, and numbers valid.
frontend/src/lib/state/appFlowTypes.ts: Defines data types for student records, parsed datasets, and semester analytics.
frontend/src/lib/students/lookupStudentR: Looks up student records by roll number with normalized, case-insensitive matching.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point setting up React Query, Internet Identity Provider, and rendering the main app.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining dark mode, content paths, extended colors, layout settings, custom keyframes, and plugin usage.
project_state.json: JSON file describing the project state, including versioning, existing features, new feature requests, and project metadata.
